channel.title: SwitchBlade Compiler
channel.description:
Hello everybody. I was bored today, and I decided I will make a compiler. Just for you. In visual basic. Now I already know most of you stupid teenagers on here will flame, GTFO I can post visual basic here because my program is Server related.
Now, the actual visual basic program doesn't do too much. It opens up a batch file so you can compile. This is helpful because instead of being 30 folders deep in Java files, you can go to your desktop, click on the shortcut and it opens up a batch file. It opens up a certain batch file that's already included in the .rar file.
Now of course there isn't much to this program, it's pretty self explanatory, but I am not the best coder. So, if you do not follow the instructions on how to use the program. You will fail.
1. You need to extract it to your Program Files on your C: drive. 2. You need to make a Shortcut on your desktop for whichever program you want(I have made 3 versions included). 3. Now you need to make a shortcut for one of the batch files(Single, or Server wide Compiler) inside of your runescape private server. 4. Then run the program to test that it works.
This is a more elaborate explanation. Because of my style of Coding. I keep my projects in my Program Files. And the code for opening the batch file is in shell. Since I do not know what your server is going to be named I won't make a seperate compiling for everybody who DL's. So the way I developed my compiler is how a 508+ compiler's are made. It calls upon the folder name and then compiles the java files in that specific folder. [code]@Echo Off :Top Cls Title SwitchBlade Server Compiler - Menu Color f0
CD C:\Users\Austin\Desktop\Java\ Echo Please choose a destination. Echo. Echo Change Directory. cd Echo Compiler. Com Echo. Echo. Echo. Set /p Dest=_:
If %Dest% == cd Goto cd If %Dest% == Com Goto Com If %Dest% == CD Goto cd If %Dest% == Cd Goto cd If %Dest% == cD Goto cd If %Dest% == cOm Goto Com If %Dest% == coM Goto Com If %Dest% == COm Goto Com If %Dest% == COM Goto Com If %Dest% == cOM Goto Com If %Dest% == com Goto Com
:cd Cls Title SwitchBlade Server Compiler - Change Directory
Echo Please enter the new location of the file directory. Echo. "MENU" to go back to the menu. Echo. Set /p CD=Location: Cls
If %CD% == MENU Goto Top
CD %CD%
Echo. Echo Directory Changed. Pause Goto Top
:Com Cls Title SwitchBlade Server Compiler - Java Compiler
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" *.java Pause
Goto Top [/code]
It works as it compiles in the directory you entered or had preset. Download and give it a try. This isn't suppose to be some fancy super advanced compiler. Just a shortcut so you don't have to keep going back and forth through folders to get to the compiler. [IMG]http://i725.photobucket.com/albums/ww251/austinsobes/Proof.png[/img] [size=36pt]REMEMBER TO EXTRACT TO PROGRAM FILES![/size]
http://www.mediafire.com/?nrhtoucz79l9aa1 http://www.mediafire.com/?nrhtoucz79l9aa1 http://www.mediafire.com/?nrhtoucz79l9aa1

item.title: SwitchBlade Compiler
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

wavemaker:

This is really not needed, there are things called IDE’s. They auto-compile. DERP DERP

If you give me an IDE for developing a Runescape Private Server. I will give you 1000$ dollars. This is just a program to open up the compiler without going through all of the folders. Because I know that when I am programming, and i’m like 5 folders deep in models and java files. I don’t like backing all the way out, and then having to go back in and scroll. I’m just too lazy, so now you have this on your desktop. edit. Minimize. Click. Edit. Mini. Click. It’s just a faster way of doing things, since the compiler I made has no need for closing, once it’s finished compiling it goes back to the home screen, so you can retype “Com” and compile another and over and over.

Read full topic

item.title: SwitchBlade Compiler
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

Solitaire:

Nice i wanted to learn c# but decided to learn java insted

Yeah I tried java for a while, but I like the way the Visual languages from microsoft feel. They are just a really comfortable area for me to code in. Since I like the way I can easily use the graphics interface they offer to create fast working apps and stuff. It’s just a more fitting way to me, since DOS isn’t really my thing. I’m going to start developing xbox arcade games with XNA. Going to by 3-4 advanced books on C#, get as good as I can all the experience and stuff that I will need to be on my way. Lol

Read full topic

item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

Solitaire:

Nice program will come in handy

Thanks. I decided to keep it in the program files because I spent like an hour trying to use the CurDir commands. eh, screw VB. I’m going to start in C# soon. way more flexibility, I’ll probably remake this in C#, make it better. Maybe find a way to compile inside of the actual application.

item.title: SwitchBlade Compiler
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

Hello everybody. I was bored today, and I decided I will make a compiler. Just for you. In visual basic. Now I already know most of you stupid teenagers on here will flame, GTFO I can post visual basic here because my program is Server related.

Now, the actual visual basic program doesn’t do too much. It opens up a batch file so you can compile. This is helpful because instead of being 30 folders deep in Java files, you can go to your desktop, click on the shortcut and it opens up a batch file. It opens up a certain batch file that’s already included in the .rar file.

Now of course there isn’t much to this program, it’s pretty self explanatory, but I am not the best coder. So, if you do not follow the instructions on how to use the program. You will fail.

  1. You need to extract it to your Program Files on your C: drive.
  2. You need to make a Shortcut on your desktop for whichever program you want(I have made 3 versions included).
  3. Now you need to make a shortcut for one of the batch files(Single, or Server wide Compiler) inside of your runescape private server.
  4. Then run the program to test that it works.

This is a more elaborate explanation. Because of my style of Coding. I keep my projects in my Program Files. And the code for opening the batch file is in shell. Since I do not know what your server is going to be named I won’t make a seperate compiling for everybody who DL’s. So the way I developed my compiler is how a 508+ compiler’s are made. It calls upon the folder name and then compiles the java files in that specific folder.

[code]@Echo Off
:Top
Cls
Title SwitchBlade Server Compiler - Menu
Color f0

CD C:\Users\Austin\Desktop\Java
Echo Please choose a destination.
Echo.
Echo Change Directory. cd
Echo Compiler. Com
Echo.
Echo.
Echo.
Set /p Dest=_:

If %Dest% == cd Goto cd
If %Dest% == Com Goto Com
If %Dest% == CD Goto cd
If %Dest% == Cd Goto cd
If %Dest% == cD Goto cd
If %Dest% == cOm Goto Com
If %Dest% == coM Goto Com
If %Dest% == COm Goto Com
If %Dest% == COM Goto Com
If %Dest% == cOM Goto Com
If %Dest% == com Goto Com

:cd
Cls
Title SwitchBlade Server Compiler - Change Directory

Echo Please enter the new location of the file directory.
Echo. “MENU” to go back to the menu.
Echo.
Set /p CD=Location:
Cls

If %CD% == MENU Goto Top

CD %CD%

Echo.
Echo Directory Changed.
Pause
Goto Top

:Com
Cls
Title SwitchBlade Server Compiler - Java Compiler

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe” *.java
Pause

Goto Top
[/code]

It works as it compiles in the directory you entered or had preset. Download and give it a try. This isn’t suppose to be some fancy super advanced compiler. Just a shortcut so you don’t have to keep going back and forth through folders to get to the compiler.

Proof.png825×369

[size=36pt]REMEMBER TO EXTRACT TO PROGRAM FILES![/size]
